articles.title: Iga Swiatek wins 35th consecutive match to claim 2nd French Open title - CBC Sports
articles.description: Top-ranked Iga Swiatek beat 18-year-old American Coco Gauff 6-1, 6-3 in the French Open women's final Saturday in Paris to collect her second title at Roland Garros and stretch her winning streak to 35 matches.
articles.content:
Iga Swiatek is so efficient, so smooth, with a racket in her hand, seemingly never flustered a bit and, for months now, never beaten.
The only time she looked even the slightest bit shaken Saturday … [+5814 chars]

articles.author: Simon Cambers, Tom Hamilton, D'Arcy Maine
articles.title: Iga Swiatek wins French Open, bests Coco Gauff in women's final - ESPN
articles.description: On Saturday, world No. 1 Iga Swiatek beat rising American star Coco Gauff in the French Open final. Updates on all the action as it happened.
articles.content:
PARIS -- After two weeks of play at Roland Garros, world No. 1 Iga Swiatek and 18-year-old American Coco Gauff met for the title.
Swiatek, the 2020 French Open champion, got her consecutive win No. … [+8559 chars]

articles.title: Ukraine war: Russia destroyed US-supplied weapons in dozens, claims Putin - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Ukraine war: Russian president Vladimir Putin's claim of destroying American-supplied weapons comes days after Washington DC unveiled a $700 million package of sophisticated weapons for Ukraine. | World News
articles.content:
Russian president Vladimir Putin on Saturday said that his forces were already destroying American-supplied weapons by dozen, news agency Reuters quoted Russian news agency RIA.

articles.title: Intel Arc A370M GPU-Powered laptops open to preorders for North American, New Zealand, & Australian markets - Wccftech
articles.description: Intel's Arc A370M entry-level GPU is now available for preorders in North America, Australian, and New Zealand markets.
articles.content:
Intel's Arc A370M entry-level discrete graphics will begin to see more visibility outside South Korea, with North America, Australian, and New Zealand markets now offering pre-orders.

articles.title: As Ukraine loses troops, how long can it keep up the fight? - CTV News
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said this week that Ukraine is now losing 60 to 100 soldiers each day in combat. By way of comparison, just short of 50 American soldiers died per day on average in 1968 during the Vietnam War's deadliest year for U.S. …
articles.content:
